newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian shares wait for next week.
newsitem.headline: Belgian shares wait for next week.

text.p: Belgian shares, steady in cautious early trade after a weaker start on Thursday, are already focusing on next week when the outcome of French elections will be known, dealers said.
At 0825 GMT, the Bel-20 index was up 0.06 percent at 2,259.44 with 200 million francs worth of shares traded.

"We're still waiting. It should all become clearer next week, after the elections in France. Bond markets will also have calmed down then," one said. A row between the German government and the Bundesbank over gold revaluation plans was another reason to be cautious, he said.
He said the weaker start had been caused by nervousness over the Paris opening. "But it opened firmer, which gave us and the Dutch a bit of courage," he said.
A major reshuffle involving three Belgian holdings had also been digested and speculation involving banks BBL and Kredietbank and insurance company Royale Belge had nearly evaporated.

Wednesday's batch of dividend coupon payments was also discounted but could still weigh on the market temporarily. "After the dividend period some might decrease their positions, get out," one dealer said.
